message: ITC Why it may emerge as a surprise suitor in FMCG buyouts The outlook for cigarettes has improved with rising mobility particularly higher office occupancy rates FY25 will see it normalise raising the question of what next to drive growth ITC may seek deals in FMCG sector In Moneycontrol Pro we hadÂ highlighted way back in August 2020Â the risks to cigarette consumption from people staying indoors whether it was for work study or entertainment Eventually the full opening up of the economy and now with more people returning to offices to academic institutions and travel has driven a recovery in the cigarette industry s volume growth The benefits to cigarette consumption are expected to continue in FY24 as well After an 18 percent increase in cigarette sales volumes in FY23 the current fiscal is expected to see a healthy volume growth of 79 percent and then settle closer to the longterm average of 5 percent growth according to rating agency CRISIL Healthy growth rates are on the back of rising office occupancy which are expected to rise to 6570 percent in the current fiscal compared to 40 percent a year ago Companies such as ITC have been expanding their distribution to expand reach in rural markets launch new variants targeted at different consumer segments both to grow consumption and drive up the share of higher margin premium cigarettes The growth in cigarette sales has also given them the ability to cushion higher tobacco costs which have risen by 2025 percent CAGR in the past three years according to CRISIL Tobacco prices have not been a major concern for cigarette companies as they have pricing power and a benign taxation regime in recent years has also strengthened their pricing power The big winner from these trends is of course ITC If CRISIL s prediction plays out then its volume growth accompanied by price increases and a healthier product mix is likely to see its cigarette business revenue and margins improve And even when growth settles into a normal range from FY25 onwards it will continue to play a significant role In the June quarter ITC s cigarettes business contributed to 77 percent of segment profit and 764 percent in FY24 ITC s shares have cooled down of late coinciding with a sluggish period for FMCG stocks but also because of investor disappointment with the structure of its hotels demerger plan It has fallen 10 percent since July 20 a time when the Nifty FMCG index is down by 47 percent A steady outlook for the cigarettes business may already be priced in the hotels demerger is also behind us now and what really remains to drive valuations is any change in the outlook for its FMCG business While rising growth and profits are aspects investors will watch out for the real differentiator for FMCG could be what ITC will do with the cash its cigarettes business throws up In FY24 total net cash generated from operations rose by 21 percent to Rs 17912 crore and is likely to rise further in the current fiscal Paying more dividends is of course an option But with hotels also out of the picture there may be enough spare cash to fund buyouts too Already competitive deal activity in the FMCG sector has stepped up with companies and private equity investors sniffing around for targets It won t be surprising if ITC emerges as a surprise buyer in some of these transactions

message: they have already announced the demerger of hotels division which has shown spectacular results in the past year  after becoming a debt free subsidiary with 1000 cr being given to the division as their initial cash balance the hotel division itself may turn out a positive surprise as far as the valuations are concerned  the division is making profits of over 1000 cr pat after tax and as mr puri said their capital requirements for smaller hotels in tier 2 towns will be much smaller as they already have presence in tier 1 cities across the country  with policy of management contracts their cash requirements will still be lower which means they wot require the 1000 cr cash chest immediately  their internal accruals of 1000 cr per annum will be sufficient for their growth this means the division will remain debt free and still grow aggressively with cash balances available to buy any marquee chain or hotel properties available any where in the world  all divisions are firing and we can see a 15 cagr in eps for the next 23 years in itc taking the present eps from rs 16 to rs 24 in 3 yrs  which even at a reasonable pe of 30 shud give price targets of 720 in 3 years  i personally feel as fmcg division shows higher profits and it business propels growth and is demerger the pe of 35 and price targets of rs 840 is definitely possible in 3 years in the stock and don t forget wile this happens the dividend distribution will just get bigger and better in itc  so this remains a favored stock to play in india growth story and a possible indian multinational in the making

message: hotelstofmcg major itc on october 19 reported a standalone net profit of rs 492696 crore for the september quarter of the current financial year a growth of 1032 percent from the yearago period revenue from operations came in at rs 1770508 crore up 317 percent from rs 1715956 crore in the yearago quarter the company said in a regulatory filing the numbers moreorless met estimates according to a poll of four brokerages the net profit was expected at rs 49339 crore and revenue at rs 16870 crore during the quarter fmcg excluding cigarettes segment revenue was up 83 percent yearonyear yoy segment ebitda margin expanded 150 bps yoy to 11 percent

message: ITC  Resistance Rs 470500  Support Rs 435 ITC is coming out of long consolidation and is in the process of forming the right shoulder of an Inverse Head and Shoulder pattern on the longterm timeframe The overall structure is remunerative as the stock trades above its allimportant moving averages Its MACD is supporting the current strength whereas the momentum indicator RSI is also positively poised On the upside the Rs 470 level is the neckline and an immediate hurdle above this one can expect a move towards Rs 500 On the downside the Rs 435 level is a strong demand zone at any pullback
Post: ITC  Resistance Rs 470500  Support Rs 435 ITC is coming out of long consolidation and is in the process of forming the right shoulder of an Inverse Head and Shoulder pattern on the longterm timeframe The overall structure is remunerative as the stock trades above its allimportant moving averages Its MACD is supporting the current strength whereas the momentum indicator RSI is also positively poised On the upside the Rs 470 level is the neckline and an immediate hurdle above this one can expect a move towards Rs 500 On the downside the Rs 435 level is a strong demand zone at any pullback

message: TC Ltd on Monday posted its third quarter earnings for the financial year 202324 with profit at Rs crore up 89 per cent in comparison to Rs crore during the corresponding quarter of last year surpassing estimates It posted revenue from operations at Rs 1948450 crore marginally higher than Rs 1927002 crore during the third quarter of FY23 According to a CNBC TV18 poll ITC was expected to report Q3FY24 profit at Rs 5130 crore and revenue was estimated at Rs 17050 crore

message: British American Tobacco actively working to sell part of its stake in ITC British American Tobacco ITCu2019s largest shareholder has said it has been actively working to sell a part of its stake in the Indian tobaccotohotels company BAT owns 2901 percent stake worth some Rs 15 lakh crore in ITC The shares slumped 4 percent compared with a 1 percent decline in the benchmark Sensex ITC is Indiau2019s top cigarette maker It recently became the largest in the foods segment and runs the secondlargest hotel chain Why itu2019s important BAT has often been the only ITC shareholder to raise issues in the firm It had earlier said it does not need more than 25 percent stake to continuing to wield strategic influence and veto rights
Post: British American Tobacco actively working to sell part of its stake in ITC British American Tobacco ITCu2019s largest shareholder has said it has been actively working to sell a part of its stake in the Indian tobaccotohotels company BAT owns 2901 percent stake worth some Rs 15 lakh crore in ITC The shares slumped 4 percent compared with a 1 percent decline in the benchmark Sensex ITC is Indiau2019s top cigarette maker It recently became the largest in the foods segment and runs the secondlargest hotel chain Why itu2019s important BAT has often been the only ITC shareholder to raise issues in the firm It had earlier said it does not need more than 25 percent stake to continuing to wield strategic influence and veto rights

message: ITC considers buying 47 percent stake in Prataap Snacks from Peak XV Partners ITC may acquire the 47 percent stake held by Peak XV Partners earlier Sequoia Capital in listed Prataap Snacks the Economic Times reported This follows the failure of talks with Haldiramu2019s owing to a valuation mismatch Buyout funds KKR TA Associates and Apax are among those that have been tapped since Peak XV planned to fully exit its investment in Prataap and hired Deutsche Bank to sell the company Why itu2019s important ITC may see Prataap giving it some headroom in regional pockets where it hasnu2019t made inroads due to localised competition A successful transaction will trigger an open offer
Post: ITC considers buying 47 percent stake in Prataap Snacks from Peak XV Partners ITC may acquire the 47 percent stake held by Peak XV Partners earlier Sequoia Capital in listed Prataap Snacks the Economic Times reported This follows the failure of talks with Haldiramu2019s owing to a valuation mismatch Buyout funds KKR TA Associates and Apax are among those that have been tapped since Peak XV planned to fully exit its investment in Prataap and hired Deutsche Bank to sell the company Why itu2019s important ITC may see Prataap giving it some headroom in regional pockets where it hasnu2019t made inroads due to localised competition A successful transaction will trigger an open offer

message: Now the ITC fully under the big hands See when in the december the news came the BAT wish to sell stake but price remain between 440 to 477 range Now when again news came in the past the share came down with ex dividend upto Rs400 Simply understand the game  the big investors who keep near to 20000 cr to invest in the ITC and wish to add the stake of BAT on lower price so they are keep the price below Rs420 and so when BAT will sell they will come to sell on discosunt price near to Rs400 The other factors in the January month and February the big investors who enter near to Rs474 like GQG who added more than 2 stake sure to add at the current price price to reduced the cost which is now 15 plus see they added to earn not less than 20 from Rs474 and now in the loss of 16  whether me or any one sure to add on lower price Now wait and watch the what strategy used by BAT whether they wish to sell on lower price or play like me  Simply if i only pledge the share on 9 interest till the listing of hotel segments becuase till the listing of hotel  first earned nearto 150 to 2 dividend and rest 7 interest compensate to sell only near to Rs550 and after pledge find 80 cash to used to add more share on which also earned 150 to 2 dividend and price appreciation from Rs410 to 550 near to 35 So keep note BAT near sell at the current price and see they take the loan against the share on the rate of 5 to 6  in the USA and now only think to sell at Rs550 plus The BAT can play another game and give veto right to listing to cigrette business as a seperate company keeping in view of the peers shares prices in India and in that case due to 29 holdings they have maximum benefits I added and suggested to add at Rs169 and from Rs420 to RS 400 on every dip add Tally view is very right that in the next six month its cross 535 to 550 plus so need to worry PasPas 11 neither even after added at Rs160 i never sold a single share and only wish to add more

message: In a significant move targeting several major players in the fastmoving consumer goods FMCG sector the Directorate General of GST Intelligence DGGI has initiated actions against FMCG companies including ITC Prataap Snacks PepsiCo Balaji Wafers RP Sanjiv Goenka Group and others for alleged tax evasion Sources told CNBCTV18 that the DGGI has escalated its crackdown on nearly 1012 FMCG companies citing issues related to classification leading to alleged tax evasion The DGGI has sent notices and investigation intimation letters to FMCG companies for paying a lower rate of Goods and Services Tax GST on products coming under the head of u2014 extruded snacks and fried pellet snacks sources said The government had in 2023 clarified that any snacks that have been prepared by extrusion process should attract 18 and not 12 as is being paid by the industry currently Extrusion is a technique to create readytoeat puffed snacks
Post: In a significant move targeting several major players in the fastmoving consumer goods FMCG sector the Directorate General of GST Intelligence DGGI has initiated actions against FMCG companies including ITC Prataap Snacks PepsiCo Balaji Wafers RP Sanjiv Goenka Group and others for alleged tax evasion Sources told CNBCTV18 that the DGGI has escalated its crackdown on nearly 1012 FMCG companies citing issues related to classification leading to alleged tax evasion The DGGI has sent notices and investigation intimation letters to FMCG companies for paying a lower rate of Goods and Services Tax GST on products coming under the head of u2014 extruded snacks and fried pellet snacks sources said The government had in 2023 clarified that any snacks that have been prepared by extrusion process should attract 18 and not 12 as is being paid by the industry currently Extrusion is a technique to create readytoeat puffed snacks

message: After reaching a peak near Rs 475 mark on January 4 2024 ITC has experienced a significant decline of approximately 75 rupees which represents a decline of approximately 16 percent However in the subsequent 18 trading sessions ITC has shown stability by avoiding further declines and has instead consolidated within a range of Rs 400416 Notably in the previous trading session there was notable buying interest observed at lower levels accompanied by substantial trading volume From a technical standpoint the formation of a bullish ABCD pattern on the daily chart of ITC within the mentioned price zone of Rs 400416 Interestingly this zone also coincides with the 0382 percent retracement level of a price swing that occurred between January 2023 and July 2023 as indicated on the chart Additionally it has formed complex structure forming on the daily relative strength index RSI indicator resembling a W shape below the 30 level which suggests a potentially lucrative buying opportunity Thus one can buy in the zone of Rs 405415 with an upside target of Rs 451 and a stoploss would be placed near Rs 389 on a daily close basis

message: British American Tobacco Plc the maker of Lucky Strike cigarettes is preparing to kick off a sale of part of its stake in Indian partner ITC Ltd as soon as this week people with knowledge of the matter said Londonlisted BAT has been speaking with Bank of America Corp and Citigroup Inc about a potential divestment of around 2 billion to 3 billion in ITC stock through block trades the people said Such deals are usually done at a discount to the market price Details of the transaction could still change and the launch of the offering may spill into next week depending on market conditions the people said asking not to be identified because the information is private BAT currently owns about 29 percent of Mumbailisted ITC according to data compiled by Bloomberg The UK company said last month that itu2019s considering monetizing part of its holding
Post: British American Tobacco Plc the maker of Lucky Strike cigarettes is preparing to kick off a sale of part of its stake in Indian partner ITC Ltd as soon as this week people with knowledge of the matter said Londonlisted BAT has been speaking with Bank of America Corp and Citigroup Inc about a potential divestment of around 2 billion to 3 billion in ITC stock through block trades the people said Such deals are usually done at a discount to the market price Details of the transaction could still change and the launch of the offering may spill into next week depending on market conditions the people said asking not to be identified because the information is private BAT currently owns about 29 percent of Mumbailisted ITC according to data compiled by Bloomberg The UK company said last month that itu2019s considering monetizing part of its holding

message: British American Tobacco readies 4 percent ITC stake sale for around Rs 20000 crore British American Tobacco is preparing for its stake sale in ITC in the next two weeks the Mint reported The British MNC will sell 4 percent stake at Rs 380390 per share a 58 percent discount to Mondayu2019s closing Around 499 million shares worth around Rs 20000 crore over 24 billion are expected to change hands Why itu2019s important This would be the biggest block deal in the Indian stock market since 2021 when Bosch saw block deals worth Rs 29000 crore A big investor paring stake is typically seen as a negative which would be an overhang for ITCu2019s stock
Post: British American Tobacco readies 4 percent ITC stake sale for around Rs 20000 crore British American Tobacco is preparing for its stake sale in ITC in the next two weeks the Mint reported The British MNC will sell 4 percent stake at Rs 380390 per share a 58 percent discount to Mondayu2019s closing Around 499 million shares worth around Rs 20000 crore over 24 billion are expected to change hands Why itu2019s important This would be the biggest block deal in the Indian stock market since 2021 when Bosch saw block deals worth Rs 29000 crore A big investor paring stake is typically seen as a negative which would be an overhang for ITCu2019s stock

message: British American Tobacco has launched a block deal to sell 35 percent equity stake in Indias ITC Ltd to institutional investors for as much as Rs 16775 crore The British cigarette makers India unit plans to sell up to 4369 crore ITC shares via accelerated book building at Rs 38440025 per share reported CNBC Awaaz citing sources The share sale in ITC through a block trade will cut the holding of ITCs singlelargest shareholder to about 255 percent from about 29 percent There is a 180day lockin period for BAT to sell further stake in ITC
Post: British American Tobacco has launched a block deal to sell 35 percent equity stake in Indias ITC Ltd to institutional investors for as much as Rs 16775 crore The British cigarette makers India unit plans to sell up to 4369 crore ITC shares via accelerated book building at Rs 38440025 per share reported CNBC Awaaz citing sources The share sale in ITC through a block trade will cut the holding of ITCs singlelargest shareholder to about 255 percent from about 29 percent There is a 180day lockin period for BAT to sell further stake in ITC

message: British American Tobacco to offload 35 percent stake in ITC in block deals today British American Tobacco will sell around 35 percent of its stake in ITC to institutional investors in block deals today the Economic Times reported The price range for the proposed sale of shares is Rs 38440025 apiece a discount of up to 5 percent at the lower end of the price band The total offer size would be Rs 16775 crore at the lower end of the price range Why itu2019s important Bat would still have a 25 percent stake in ITC after the sale enough to retain strategic influence and veto rights This will be one of the largest block deals in recent times
Post: British American Tobacco to offload 35 percent stake in ITC in block deals today British American Tobacco will sell around 35 percent of its stake in ITC to institutional investors in block deals today the Economic Times reported The price range for the proposed sale of shares is Rs 38440025 apiece a discount of up to 5 percent at the lower end of the price band The total offer size would be Rs 16775 crore at the lower end of the price range Why itu2019s important Bat would still have a 25 percent stake in ITC after the sale enough to retain strategic influence and veto rights This will be one of the largest block deals in recent times

message: After reaching a peak near Rs 475 mark on January 4 2024 ITC has experienced a significant decline of approximately 75 rupees which represents a decline of approximately 16 percent However in the subsequent 18 trading sessions ITC has shown stability by avoiding further declines and has instead consolidated within a range of Rs 400416 Notably in the previous trading session there was notable buying interest observed at lower levels accompanied by substantial trading volume From a technical standpoint the formation of a bullish ABCD pattern on the daily chart of ITC within the mentioned price zone of Rs 400416 Interestingly this zone also coincides with the 0382 percent retracement level of a price swing that occurred between January 2023 and July 2023 as indicated on the chart Additionally it has formed complex structure forming on the daily relative strength index RSI indicator resembling a W shape below the 30 level which suggests a potentially lucrative buying opportunity Thus one can buy in the zone of Rs 415425 with an upside target of Rs 475 and a stoploss would be placed near Rs 390 on a daily close basis

message: After reaching a peak near Rs 475 mark on January 4 2024 ITC has experienced a significant decline of 16 percent However in the subsequent 18 trading sessions ITC has shown stability by avoiding further declines and has instead consolidated within a range of Rs 400416 Notably in the previous trading session there was notable buying interest observed at lower levels accompanied by substantial trading volume From a technical standpoint the formation of a bullish ABCD pattern on the daily chart of ITC within the mentioned price zone of Rs 400416 Interestingly this zone also coincides with the 0382 percent retracement level of a price swing that occurred between January 2023 and July 2023 as indicated on the chart Additionally it has formed complex structure forming on the daily RSI indicator resembling a W shape below the 30 level which suggests a potentially lucrative buying opportunity Thus one can buy in the zone of Rs 415425 with an upside target of Rs 475 and a stoploss would be placed near Rs 390 on a daily close basis

message: After reaching a peak near Rs 475 mark on January 4 2024 ITC has experienced a significant decline of approximately 16 percent However in the subsequent 18 trading sessions ITC has shown stability by avoiding further declines and has instead consolidated within a range of Rs 400416 Notably in the previous trading session there was notable buying interest observed at lower levels accompanied by substantial trading volume From a technical standpoint the formation of a bullish ABCD pattern on the daily chart of ITC within the mentioned price zone of Rs 400416 Interestingly this zone also coincides with the 0382 percent retracement level of a price swing that occurred between January 2023 and July 2023 as indicated on the chart Additionally RSI weekly has reversed from 45 levels which suggests a potentially lucrative buying opportunity Thus one can buy in the zone of Rs 430440 with an upside target of Rs 480 and a stoploss would be placed near Rs 412 on a daily close basis

message: ITC Ltd plans to more than double its exports of raw tobacco by value to its largest shareholder British American Tobacco by 202526
Post: ITC Ltd plans to more than double its exports of raw tobacco by value to its largest shareholder British American Tobacco by 202526

message:
ITC Ltd plans to significantly increase exports of raw tobacco to British American Tobacco targeting a value of up to Rs 2350 crore by 202526 This move follows a decline in exports last fiscal The proposal requires shareholder approval due to its scale and relatedparty nature under SEBI regulations

Since this is a related party transaction which exceeds Rs 1000 crore or 10 percentage of the annual consolidated turnover of ITC whichever is lower it would need shareholder approval as per regulation of the Securities and Exchange Board of India and ITC policy on related party transactions

The company said it has been engaged in development procurement and supply of unmanufactured tobacco over the last several decades and is the largest exporter of unmanufactured tobacco from India ITC said in the report it has been exporting unmanufactured tobacco to BAT for several years
Post:
ITC Ltd plans to significantly increase exports of raw tobacco to British American Tobacco targeting a value of up to Rs 2350 crore by 202526 This move follows a decline in exports last fiscal The proposal requires shareholder approval due to its scale and relatedparty nature under SEBI regulations

Since this is a related party transaction which exceeds Rs 1000 crore or 10 percentage of the annual consolidated turnover of ITC whichever is lower it would need shareholder approval as per regulation of the Securities and Exchange Board of India and ITC policy on related party transactions

The company said it has been engaged in development procurement and supply of unmanufactured tobacco over the last several decades and is the largest exporter of unmanufactured tobacco from India ITC said in the report it has been exporting unmanufactured tobacco to BAT for several years

message: The opening of 116key Welcomhotel Belagavi aligns with the expansion of the Welcomhotel brand Welcomhotel is the new age travellers key to curated immersive experiences The brand Welcomhotel is aligned with ITC Hotels asset light growth strategy to take our brand and services to tier II markets in addition to prime metro cities ITC Hotels Chief Executive Officer Anil Chadha said in a statement The brand opened seven managed hotels and three owned assets with a total of 916 keys over the last 5 years In the last financial year FY 202324 four new management deals with 406 keys were signed for the Welcomhotel brand which are slated to open over the coming 45 years
Post: The opening of 116key Welcomhotel Belagavi aligns with the expansion of the Welcomhotel brand Welcomhotel is the new age travellers key to curated immersive experiences The brand Welcomhotel is aligned with ITC Hotels asset light growth strategy to take our brand and services to tier II markets in addition to prime metro cities ITC Hotels Chief Executive Officer Anil Chadha said in a statement The brand opened seven managed hotels and three owned assets with a total of 916 keys over the last 5 years In the last financial year FY 202324 four new management deals with 406 keys were signed for the Welcomhotel brand which are slated to open over the coming 45 years

Post: ITCs daily chart displays a confirmed breakout from a Flag and Pole Pattern with heightened volume signaling buyer resurgence Trading near the high backed by support from the Fast and Slow EMAs signifies positive price action and sentiment The upward trend in the Slow EMA and a positive RSI breakout reflect a strong uptrend Additionally the DMIplua Directional Movement Index leading DMI indicates a favourable trend while the ADX trading above the 40 mark suggests increasing strength in market dynamics

Quant MF buys ITC shares worth Rs 3669 crore in July trims HDFC Bank stake

Quant Mutual Fund purchased shares worth Rs 3669 crore in ITC in July Simultaneously the fund sold 295 crore shares in HDFC Bank worth Rs 4763 crore

message:
ITC arm ITC Infotech acquires cloud solutions firm Blazeclan Technologies for Rs 485 cr

HotelstoFMCG conglomerate ITC said on October 1 that its whollyowned subidiary ITC Infotech India Limited has acquired 100 percent shares in cloud solutions company Blazeclan Technologies for Rs 485 crore

Blazeclan is an AWS Premier Partner Snowflake Elite Partner and a leader in providing Cloud transformation solutions to customers globally ITC said in an exchange filing The company also has expertise in cloud migration digital services digital cloud consulting and data analytics and insights It had a turnover of Rs 29457 crore in 202324

The company has operations in India Singapore Australia Malaysia Philippines New Zealand Belgium USA and Canada
Post:
ITC arm ITC Infotech acquires cloud solutions firm Blazeclan Technologies for Rs 485 cr

HotelstoFMCG conglomerate ITC said on October 1 that its whollyowned subidiary ITC Infotech India Limited has acquired 100 percent shares in cloud solutions company Blazeclan Technologies for Rs 485 crore

Blazeclan is an AWS Premier Partner Snowflake Elite Partner and a leader in providing Cloud transformation solutions to customers globally ITC said in an exchange filing The company also has expertise in cloud migration digital services digital cloud consulting and data analytics and insights It had a turnover of Rs 29457 crore in 202324

The company has operations in India Singapore Australia Malaysia Philippines New Zealand Belgium USA and Canada

message: NCLT sanctioned ITC demerger
Post: NCLT sanctioned ITC demerger

message:
ITC Ltd  today said the Kolkata bench of the National Company Law Tribunal has approved the demerger of its hotels business to ITC Hotels Ltd The Scheme will be effective on the first day of the following month after filing of the certified copy of the NCLT order with the registrar of companies West Bengal the company said in an exchange filing 
The hotels business of the demerged company is well poised to chart its own growth path and operate as a separate listed entity in the fast growing hospitality industry it said In May the Competition Commission of India had approved the demerger ITC will hold a 40 per cent stake in the demerged entity the company had said
Post:
ITC Ltd  today said the Kolkata bench of the National Company Law Tribunal has approved the demerger of its hotels business to ITC Hotels Ltd The Scheme will be effective on the first day of the following month after filing of the certified copy of the NCLT order with the registrar of companies West Bengal the company said in an exchange filing 
The hotels business of the demerged company is well poised to chart its own growth path and operate as a separate listed entity in the fast growing hospitality industry it said In May the Competition Commission of India had approved the demerger ITC will hold a 40 per cent stake in the demerged entity the company had said

F and O Inclusion

As per the current methodology ITC Hotels stock needs to have at least a six month trading history to even qualify for derivative inclusion Hence ITC Hotels inclusion in the Futures  and Options  segment is unlikely

F and O Inclusion

As per the current methodology ITC Hotels stock needs to have at least a six month trading history to even qualify for derivative inclusion Hence ITC Hotels inclusion in the Futures  and Options  segment is unlikely

message:
ITC Hotels Share Price Target 2025

Tapse recommends to buy ITC Hotels shares after its listing on the bourses He said Investors should accumulate ITC Hotels on the listing day as the luxury hotel segment is growing significantly Over the next one or two years there will likely be new acquisitions and consolidation in the hotel industry

Speaking about the target price he said The valuations I am talking about ie 2022 EV over EBITDA are very conservative Many hotel stocks today are trading around 30 EV over EBITDA so if we consider the higher end the stock could be worth Rs 250 to 300 postlisting Postlisting the stock should perform well Rs 300 could be a target within the next 12 months
Post:
ITC Hotels Share Price Target 2025

Tapse recommends to buy ITC Hotels shares after its listing on the bourses He said Investors should accumulate ITC Hotels on the listing day as the luxury hotel segment is growing significantly Over the next one or two years there will likely be new acquisitions and consolidation in the hotel industry

Speaking about the target price he said The valuations I am talking about ie 2022 EV over EBITDA are very conservative Many hotel stocks today are trading around 30 EV over EBITDA so if we consider the higher end the stock could be worth Rs 250 to 300 postlisting Postlisting the stock should perform well Rs 300 could be a target within the next 12 months

message:
ITC Hotels gears up for special preopen session today

CigarettestoFMCG conglomerate ITC Ltd shares will be in focus today January 6 as the ITC Hotels arm will be spun off into a separate entity on the bourses

Under the scheme of demerger shareholders will get one equity share of ITC Hotels for every 10 shares of ITC held with ITC keeping a 40 percent stake in the newly demerged entity The rest of the 60 percent will be held by existing shareholders proportionate to their stake in ITC

The stock is poised for some action as a special preopen session will be conducted to discover the stocks price from 900 am to 945 am Normal trading in ITC shares will resume 1000 am onwards

The price for ITC Hotels will be determined by the difference between the close price of ITC on January 3 and price of ITC discovered during the special preopen session
Post:
ITC Hotels gears up for special preopen session today

CigarettestoFMCG conglomerate ITC Ltd shares will be in focus today January 6 as the ITC Hotels arm will be spun off into a separate entity on the bourses

Under the scheme of demerger shareholders will get one equity share of ITC Hotels for every 10 shares of ITC held with ITC keeping a 40 percent stake in the newly demerged entity The rest of the 60 percent will be held by existing shareholders proportionate to their stake in ITC

The stock is poised for some action as a special preopen session will be conducted to discover the stocks price from 900 am to 945 am Normal trading in ITC shares will resume 1000 am onwards

The price for ITC Hotels will be determined by the difference between the close price of ITC on January 3 and price of ITC discovered during the special preopen session

message:
ITC Hotels Ltd has allotted 12511 crore equity shares to its shareholders as part of the ongoing restructuring process The allotment was confirmed at a Board meeting held on Jan 11 2025 following a scheme of arrangement between ITC Ltd and ITCHL

The shares were allocated to shareholders of ITC Ltd as of the record date of Jan 6 2025 This move is part of the arrangement under Sections 230 to 232 of the Companies Act 2013 and is aimed at the demerger and reorganization of both companies Following the allotment ITC Hotels will cease to be a subsidiary of ITC Limited with the change taking effect on Jan 11 2025
Post:
ITC Hotels Ltd has allotted 12511 crore equity shares to its shareholders as part of the ongoing restructuring process The allotment was confirmed at a Board meeting held on Jan 11 2025 following a scheme of arrangement between ITC Ltd and ITCHL

The shares were allocated to shareholders of ITC Ltd as of the record date of Jan 6 2025 This move is part of the arrangement under Sections 230 to 232 of the Companies Act 2013 and is aimed at the demerger and reorganization of both companies Following the allotment ITC Hotels will cease to be a subsidiary of ITC Limited with the change taking effect on Jan 11 2025

message:
ITC plans to expand its hotel business internationally beginning with neighbouring countries and West Asia its Chairman and Managing Director Sanjiv Puri said

So  far as overseas is concerned we are starting to expand We have been Indiacentric but we have started to go beyond India We have a hotel in Colombo We have one in Nepal There is one more in Nepal that we have signed up for

And over a period of time we will expand overseas primarily more focused on proximal market West Asia and over time we will look at beyond that also Or if specific interesting opportunities come out we will explore those as well Puri told PTI in an interview
Post:
ITC plans to expand its hotel business internationally beginning with neighbouring countries and West Asia its Chairman and Managing Director Sanjiv Puri said

So  far as overseas is concerned we are starting to expand We have been Indiacentric but we have started to go beyond India We have a hotel in Colombo We have one in Nepal There is one more in Nepal that we have signed up for

And over a period of time we will expand overseas primarily more focused on proximal market West Asia and over time we will look at beyond that also Or if specific interesting opportunities come out we will explore those as well Puri told PTI in an interview

message:
ITC Hotels to list on NSE BSE today

FMCGtocigarettes conglomerate ITC Ltds spunoff hotels arm ITC Hotels will list on the bourses on Wednesday

ITC decided to demerge its hotels business into a separate listed entity to unlock value for shareholders The conglomerate fixed the demerger ratio at 1isto10 which meant that shareholders holding 10 shares of ITC as on January 6 2025 would receive one share of ITC Hotels post the demerger

Following the listing ITC Hotels will be maintained in all the NSE and BSE indices at a constant price and three business days following the listing If the stock hits circuit limits the exclusion will be postponed by two trading days each time

According to Nuvama the initial market price for ITC Hotels shares could range between Rs 150175 per share

message: Definitely worth buying Right now the FII who hve exposure to ITC being in the index have received stocks of ITC hotels which is not in the index  So these funds which are benchmarked with Index will sell their holdings in ITC Hotels creating this selling and pressure Once this is over we should see price above 200 in ITC Hotels and ITc will be above 500 The rationale for ITC being that they no longer have to spend nearly 20 percent of their Cash into Hotel business which was a very small fraction of the total sales and profits of ITc but still consuming 20 percent of their Cash Profits This money can now be put to better use for organic and inorganic growth of ITC FMCG or related business

message:
SS56 ITC has given the following statement earlierIt gave one example The FMCG giant said if 1000 ordinary shares of ITC were purchased at Rs 400 per share by a shareholder the total cost of acquisition would amount to Rs 400000 before the demerger 

Now based on the share entitlement ratio 100 shares of ITC Hotels would be allotted to the said shareholder The total cost of acquisition of  400000 would be apportioned in the aforesaid ratio Rs 345960 or 8649 per cent of Rs 400000 being the total cost of acquisition of 1000 ITC shares and Rs 50040 or 1351 per cent of Rs 400000 being the total cost of acquisition of 100 shares of ITC Hotels shares
Post:
SS56 ITC has given the following statement earlierIt gave one example The FMCG giant said if 1000 ordinary shares of ITC were purchased at Rs 400 per share by a shareholder the total cost of acquisition would amount to Rs 400000 before the demerger 

Now based on the share entitlement ratio 100 shares of ITC Hotels would be allotted to the said shareholder The total cost of acquisition of  400000 would be apportioned in the aforesaid ratio Rs 345960 or 8649 per cent of Rs 400000 being the total cost of acquisition of 1000 ITC shares and Rs 50040 or 1351 per cent of Rs 400000 being the total cost of acquisition of 100 shares of ITC Hotels shares

message:
ITC has signed agreements to acquire Prasuma a company in Indias frozen chilled and readytocook foods market Prasuma specializes in products like momos baos Korean fried chicken delicatessens and raw meats offering over 170 products

ITC plans to acquire 100 percent of Prasuma over three years The first tranche of 438 percent will be acquired upfront and the remaining stake will be acquired in tranches by June 2028 based on valuation criteria

This acquisition will strengthen ITCs position in the frozen foods sector which has a market size of over Rs 10000 crore and is expected to grow the company said in the press release

Prasuma operates under the brands Prasuma Meatigo by Prasuma and Prasuma Momo Kitchen Its flagship product Prasuma Momos launched in 2019 has a leading position in the frozen momos category The company also offers products such as Baos Korean Fried Chicken and Schezwan Momo meals

Prasuma runs Meatigo a directtoconsumer platform for delicatessens and raw meats and Prasuma Momo Kitchen a cloud kitchen offering PanAsian food It operates in over 100 cities and has an annual revenue run rate of Rs 200 crore for the last three months

ITC posted a 1 percent increase in standalone net profit reaching Rs 5638 crore for the quarter ending December 31 2024 surpassing estimates The growth was primarily driven by its agriculture hotels and cigarettes businesses while its FMCG fastmoving consumer goods sector saw low singledigit growth due to a subdued demand environment In the corresponding quarter of the previous year ITC reported a net profit of Rs 5572 crore

On a consolidated basis ITCs profit dropped 7 percent to Rs 50132 crore though revenue from operations increased to Rs 20350 crore up from Rs 188804 crore yearonyear

Standalone revenue for Q3FY25 reached Rs 18290 crore an 8 percent increase from Rs 16864 crore in Q3FY24 Additionally ITC declared an interim dividend of Rs 65 per equity share as per a filing made on February 6
Post:
ITC has signed agreements to acquire Prasuma a company in Indias frozen chilled and readytocook foods market Prasuma specializes in products like momos baos Korean fried chicken delicatessens and raw meats offering over 170 products

ITC plans to acquire 100 percent of Prasuma over three years The first tranche of 438 percent will be acquired upfront and the remaining stake will be acquired in tranches by June 2028 based on valuation criteria

This acquisition will strengthen ITCs position in the frozen foods sector which has a market size of over Rs 10000 crore and is expected to grow the company said in the press release

Prasuma operates under the brands Prasuma Meatigo by Prasuma and Prasuma Momo Kitchen Its flagship product Prasuma Momos launched in 2019 has a leading position in the frozen momos category The company also offers products such as Baos Korean Fried Chicken and Schezwan Momo meals

Prasuma runs Meatigo a directtoconsumer platform for delicatessens and raw meats and Prasuma Momo Kitchen a cloud kitchen offering PanAsian food It operates in over 100 cities and has an annual revenue run rate of Rs 200 crore for the last three months

ITC posted a 1 percent increase in standalone net profit reaching Rs 5638 crore for the quarter ending December 31 2024 surpassing estimates The growth was primarily driven by its agriculture hotels and cigarettes businesses while its FMCG fastmoving consumer goods sector saw low singledigit growth due to a subdued demand environment In the corresponding quarter of the previous year ITC reported a net profit of Rs 5572 crore

On a consolidated basis ITCs profit dropped 7 percent to Rs 50132 crore though revenue from operations increased to Rs 20350 crore up from Rs 188804 crore yearonyear

Standalone revenue for Q3FY25 reached Rs 18290 crore an 8 percent increase from Rs 16864 crore in Q3FY24 Additionally ITC declared an interim dividend of Rs 65 per equity share as per a filing made on February 6

message: The year over year revenue growth rate is 8 percent which is good given the current market conditions The annual compounded revenue growth rate over the last decade is 7 percent 9 month growth rate works out to 10 percent which is higher than what has been seen in the past  Tax rate is 26 percent for the latest quarter while it was 19 percent last year resulting in lower EPS Pre tax profit was similar Margins have been hit but could normalise with time Performance is much better than the likes of HUL Dabur Colgate or Nestle When ITC had a bull run between Feb 2022 and Jul 2023 annual growth rate was a little lower Compared to Mar 2024 and Jun 2024 FII and DII shareholding has gone up marginally while retail shareholding has come down All that can be said is that FII are not exiting en masse I have found technical analysis to give me better forecasts Based on the tools that I have been using that have been mostly accurate there is a good chance of the uptrend resuming If my analysis does not work out for a few weeks I will move out Stock has not given any meaningful returns for 18 months now but this could be a consolidation pattern in a longer term uptrend All brokerage houses have a target atleast 10 to 15 percent higher than current price maybe the stock might move up afterall
Post: The year over year revenue growth rate is 8 percent which is good given the current market conditions The annual compounded revenue growth rate over the last decade is 7 percent 9 month growth rate works out to 10 percent which is higher than what has been seen in the past  Tax rate is 26 percent for the latest quarter while it was 19 percent last year resulting in lower EPS Pre tax profit was similar Margins have been hit but could normalise with time Performance is much better than the likes of HUL Dabur Colgate or Nestle When ITC had a bull run between Feb 2022 and Jul 2023 annual growth rate was a little lower Compared to Mar 2024 and Jun 2024 FII and DII shareholding has gone up marginally while retail shareholding has come down All that can be said is that FII are not exiting en masse I have found technical analysis to give me better forecasts Based on the tools that I have been using that have been mostly accurate there is a good chance of the uptrend resuming If my analysis does not work out for a few weeks I will move out Stock has not given any meaningful returns for 18 months now but this could be a consolidation pattern in a longer term uptrend All brokerage houses have a target atleast 10 to 15 percent higher than current price maybe the stock might move up afterall

message:
Though I had received ESOPs during my career never heard of SAR during those days Just checked ESOPs vs SARs

SARs are an alternative to Employee Stock Option Plans ESOPs where employees are given the option to purchase shares at a predetermined price SARs on the other hand allow employees to benefit from the appreciation of the companys stock without actually owning the shares  

Have a doubt still that why shareholder approval is required for SAR if the shares are not actually transferred to the respective employee
Post:
Though I had received ESOPs during my career never heard of SAR during those days Just checked ESOPs vs SARs

SARs are an alternative to Employee Stock Option Plans ESOPs where employees are given the option to purchase shares at a predetermined price SARs on the other hand allow employees to benefit from the appreciation of the companys stock without actually owning the shares  

Have a doubt still that why shareholder approval is required for SAR if the shares are not actually transferred to the respective employee

ITC

ITC  

The company has entered into a Business Transfer Agreement with Aditya Birla Real Estate ABREL for the acquisition of ABRELs pulp and paper business operated under the name of Century Pulp and Paper along with the assets liabilities contracts and employees as a going concern on a slump sale basis for Rs 3500 crore The acquisition is subject to approval from the Competition Commission of India and the Ministry of Environment

ITC to acquire packaged food product brand Mantra Organic for Rs 4725 crore

Post: ITC is an Indian conglomerate with diverse business interests spanning across Cigarettes Branded Packaged Foods Personal Care hotels and Agri ITC is well diversified players with Cigarette business being a cash cow which enables incubation of new high growth business The recent quarterly earnings were in line expectations but inflationary pressure weighed on consumption and FMCG business ITC also offers a decent dividend yield which can help it outperform in the near term given the macro headwinds and elevated market volatility Moreover post demerger of the assetheavy hotel business the return profile of ITC is expected to improve substantially
